meanings.definition: To make or become sallow in complexion.
meanings.sent1: She was sallowing after spending too much time indoors.
meanings.sent2: The lack of sunlight was sallowing her skin.
meanings.sent3: The vampire's attempt at sallowing his complexion backfired comically.
meanings.sent4: The gray clouds sallowed the once vibrant sky.
meanings.sent5: The illness sallowed her face, draining it of color.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to become sallow.
meanings.sent1: Her sallowing of the painting gave it an aged look.
meanings.sent2: The artist's deliberate sallowing of the canvas created a somber atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The accidental sallowing of the cake frosting made it look unappetizing.
meanings.sent4: The sallowing of the leaves signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent5: The gradual sallowing of the old photograph added a nostalgic touch.
